intro: Carduus tmoleus subsp. armatus, commonly known as the Armenian thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features robust, spiny stems and large, lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite heads, which are surrounded by bracts that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties.
